channel.title: Buzzing on The Wall Street Journal
channel.description: 用中文浏览华尔街日报热门报道

item.title: The Oscars ceremony was defined by the moment when Will Smith smacked comedian Chris Rock after he made a joke about Jada Pinkett Smith’s hair #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/6fbLcrB1wS https://t.co/HtsDToazB5
Prosecutors have been advancing a tax probe of Hunter Biden, with a grand jury hearing a witness in February about past drug use and spending habits of the president’s son https://t.co/hiWbCTIwsq

Will Smith slapped Chris Rock at the Oscars after the comedian made a joke about his wife’s hair. Jada Pinkett Smith has been open about alopecia. Here's what to know about the condition. https://t.co/gaUquOf69u
Sanctions could make it more difficult, but not impossible, for Russia to sell some of its gold to raise money while its invasion of Ukraine continues https://t.co/7G6e5BY9Pg
The White House is set to release its multitrillion-dollar budget for fiscal year 2023, including a proposal to levy new taxes on the wealthiest Americans https://t.co/JtjSzQqTt7
Jessica Chastain wins best actress for her role as Tammy Faye Bakker in “The Eyes of Tammy Faye” at the #Oscars https://t.co/ie9aEPjfp4
Apple TV+ became the first streaming service to win best picture for its film “CODA,” introducing Apple as a serious Hollywood player https://t.co/Pj3FzPhrYT

Billie Eilish and Finneas O’Connell won best original song for their theme to the James Bond film “No Time To Die.” Boasting some of the most muscular vocals Eilish has recorded, the song started with a demo the siblings made on their tour bus. https://t.co/xvuunKSqkv
Will Smith won best actor for his portrayal of Richard Williams, the father and coach of tennis stars Venus and Serena Williams in “King Richard” at the #Oscars https://t.co/wmtgVCsshW
Actor Will Smith appeared to strike presenter Chris Rock in the face on the Oscars stage after a joke about Smith’s wife, Jada Pinkett Smith https://t.co/g5g6p2pR9J

In an #Oscars year rich with high-quality and incredibly popular music–both in original songs, scores, and hot pop singles–it is fitting that the best documentary feature is a music doc, Ahmir “Questlove” Thompson’s “Summer of Soul” https://t.co/jxx9gkr0LP
In the 50 years since "The Godfather" premiered, its themes, characters and filmmaking style continue to influence hit shows #Oscars https://t.co/GAtlBRVsmy

"Encanto" wins best animated feature film at the #Oscars. The film's song, "We Don't Talk About Bruno," which was written by Lin-Manuel Miranda, was dubbed in 46 languages and rose to the top of the Billboard’s Streaming Songs chart. https://t.co/AgvEDAFqg2
At the #Oscars, Greig Fraser won for best cinematography. His visuals for “Dune” conjured the desert planet Arrakis and helped lure moviegoers back to theaters last fall. https://t.co/BO8Sl4R7LI
The award for best supporting actor went to Troy Kotsur for his role in “CODA.” He is the first deaf male actor ever to be nominated and to win an Oscar. https://t.co/zvdgdJHrLc

“Drive My Car,” the mournful Japanese film about a theater director coping with the death of his wife, directed by Ryusuke Hamaguchi and based on a story by Haruki Murakami, won best international film at the #Oscars https://t.co/ZtMW8CJ5zR
It's important to adjust your workouts when you hit 50. Here are some exercises to help keep you strong and safe into the decades to come. https://t.co/SxJRh0YW29
Actor Sean Penn has vowed to melt down his Oscar statuettes if Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelensky isn’t invited to speak at the Academy Awards ceremony. https://t.co/cUclmicYAv
Beijing is wary that its alignment with Russia during the Ukraine crisis could also cost its relationship with Europe https://t.co/p5PtsmDTzW
El Salvador’s congress approved emergency powers that suspend constitutional guarantees and loosen arrest rules for 30 days to combat a record wave of gang-related killings https://t.co/yqfqzIXtHR

Drone footage and satellite images show how devastating the assault on Mariupol has been, as Russian forces continue fighting block-by-block in an effort to gain control of the city https://t.co/Y5uEapXMhl
Russian and Ukrainian negotiators will hold their next face-to-face meeting in Istanbul, the Turkish president’s office said on Sunday https://t.co/RmvwZCzPso

Cibele Florêncio was 9 when she started playing chess. Now a single mother and maid who sometimes spends 12 hours a day cleaning houses, she was crowned vice-champion at a national chess tournament last year. https://t.co/rYagOXdFTn

The executives said air travel will still be safe even if not everyone is masked, citing air filtration systems in plane cabins and the availability of high quality masks for people who still want to wear them. https://t.co/REdjaa7l5S
As Moscow’s forces meet fierce resistance in Ukraine, Western capitals worry the Kremlin could turn to so-called tactical nuclear arms https://t.co/7UnZ864ocp

The U.S. and its allies are providing Ukraine with weapons from missiles to target tanks and aircraft. Others groups are trying to fill gaps in nonlethal equipment, from body armor to drones with thermal imaging. https://t.co/hIR38Gigyj
Soaring oil prices have brought Alaska its biggest budget surplus in nearly 20 years https://t.co/lPIhQvecUW
“Don’t come Mummy, they’re shooting.” A Ukrainian woman working in Poland journeys into areas under fire to retrieve her 12-year-old son. https://t.co/XZTEt3WqWg
Switching the clocks is bad. But permanent daylight-saving time might be worse. https://t.co/WiFrlgpnVa

Ukrainian forces said they have driven Russian troops out of a town in the northeast of the country, as Kyiv seeks to exploit a decision by Moscow to focus its efforts on controlling a swath of territory in the south and east https://t.co/89Q3wCijXn

From @WSJopinion: Healthy children don’t need Covid vaccines, writes @AllysiaFinley. Florida is right. Especially for kids under 12, the risks are trivial. And most have natural antibodies. https://t.co/susS8wSY8W
"Greenflation" was already a problem for wind and solar power. Russia’s attack on Ukraine is further driving up project costs. https://t.co/WiN05jrYXn
What is the difference between 5G and 6G? True global ubiquity https://t.co/4foa3r8sWu

From @WSJopinion: The right to free speech is a bedrock principle of the U.S. Constitution. If these law students are so blinkered by ideology that they can’t tolerate a debate over civil liberties, the future of the American legal system is in jeopardy. https://t.co/RYxpTiSQi5
Rep. Jeff Fortenberry said he plans to resign from the House, after he was convicted by a federal jury of lying to investigators in a campaign-finance case https://t.co/bJ9VkTENsi
Search teams at the site of a China Eastern Airlines crash have found the second black box https://t.co/olC6Oh10oN

Close to the fight to seize Kyiv, doctors at Hospital #8 are adjusting and improvising to treat the injured. “Of course we are not what we used to be, but neither is the rest of the country.” https://t.co/4CKy7NOKbQ

Years of tensions between Hungary and Ukraine burst into public view, when Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky castigated Hungarian leader Viktor Orban via video link as he spoke to a meeting of EU leaders. https://t.co/SRGcPrNmhy
Beijing is wary that its alignment with Russia during the Ukraine crisis could also cost its relationship with Europe https://t.co/GImpIWs1AZ

The palatial and ornate Manhattan mansions depicted on the hit HBO series "The Gilded Age" once existed, but have almost all been demolished. Take a closer look at the vanished mansions of Gilded Age New York, and some of the rare structures that remain. https://t.co/16aqlEIYlN
In his final season, Duke coach Mike Krzyzewski is back in the Final Four for the 13th time after an Elite Eight win over Arkansas https://t.co/eva5MRRZ8i
Obituary: John V. Roach, a down-home Texan who helped bring personal computers into American homes, has died https://t.co/VbcqQlunyw
The Ukrainian dumplings known as varenyky are similar to Japanese gyoza and Turkish manti, a reminder that the world’s food traditions have a lot in common. https://t.co/9gHemFSZsK

From @WSJopinion: Media and tech companies that colluded in concealing potentially critical information about Hunter Biden in 2020 will pay no price. This is what is so corrosive of trust and, in the end, of the system itself, writes @gerardtbaker. https://t.co/BVFSzOnB8p
Biden will propose a new minimum tax on households worth more than $100 million as part of his annual budget, the White House said https://t.co/CXjL56EB1V
Russia said it was refocusing its mission in Ukraine on the country’s east, indicating a shift from its initial attempt to capture Kyiv https://t.co/X18kSKOthS

Russian missiles struck a site near Lviv. The city is just 40 miles east of the Polish border. The attack occurred as President Biden was visiting the Polish capital Warsaw roughly 210 miles away. https://t.co/CBDp7OI4sW
Russian Defense Minister Sergei Shoigu said Russia would replenish its stock of weapons and invest to ensure the country’s nuclear forces would remain combat ready. https://t.co/DNGBijBvrm
A New Zealand couple hoped the 17-pound tuber they found in their garden would break the Guinness Record for a giant potato. DNA testing showed it wasn’t even a potato. https://t.co/zcLp2TTDAS
Smaller harvests loom from Argentina to Indonesia as the Russia-Ukraine war cuts global fertilizer supplies. “It’s like a scary movie,” a farmer says. https://t.co/NbR9ebOHL4
